category: Safety and Health Management Regulations/Article 35 (Worker Health Examination)
contents: Article 35 (Worker Health Examination) ① The types of health examinations conducted by the Corporation are classified as follows based on the time and subject of implementation: 1. General health examination, 2. Special health examination, 3. Placement All health examinations, ② The Chairman of the Board of Directors shall periodically conduct general health examinations for the health management of workers., ③ The Corporation shall conduct special health examinations for the health management of workers in any of the following cases. Revised December 16, 2022, 1. Workers engaged in work that exposes them to harmful factors subject to special health examinations stipulated in Article 201 of the Enforcement Rules of the Industrial Safety Act; 2. Workers who are unable to change jobs after being found to have occupational diseases as a result of the worker health examination; or workers who have a doctor's opinion that a health examination is necessary for harmful factors that caused the determination of occupational diseases despite a change in workplace, ④ The chairman of the board shall provide information on the work to be assigned to workers who fall under subparagraph 1 of paragraph 3. A medical examination must be conducted before deployment for suitability evaluation (refers to evaluating whether there are any health problems when performing the relevant work according to a doctor's opinion), and the timing and frequency of implementation are specified in Article 202 of the Enforcement Rules of the Industrial Safety Act. shall follow., ⑤ Workers shall not avoid or intentionally refuse the health examination pursuant to Paragraph 1 without justifiable reasons., ⑥ The Chairman shall provide Article 210, Paragraph 1 of the Enforcement Rules of the Industrial Safety Act to workers who require follow-up management as a result of the health examination of Corporation workers. Necessary measures may be taken to maintain the health of Corporation workers in accordance with the provisions of this Article., [Title revised on December 16, 2022]
